item.title: Adding a Cron job using the ed editor
item.description: These commands (after the first one) work in the ed editor. ed editor is used in the RStudio server shell. sudo crontab -e #opens crontab file in chosen editor a #add to file 0,30 * * * * Rscript /home/user/folder/script.R #command to add . #finished editing ,p #print file content to check w #save changes Q #quit In this example the script will run every 0 hours, 30 minutes, see Ubuntu: How do I set up a CRON job for other options.

item.title: Symbolic links and 2 common errors with them
item.description: I don’t know if it’s good or bad, but I like when the files I’m working with are in the working directory (so instead of using pathnames to my files I can just type filename or ./filename). But to avoid copying data and wasting space, symbolic links are the way to go. The command for that is: _ln -s target_file symlink, where -s stands for “symbolic” (just ln would create a hard link)
